Issues.Title: docs: add cross-platform support to the schematics for libraries guide
Issues.Body:
Add Windows friendly commands for copying schematics into the library.

Fixes #29952

## PR Checklist
Please check if your PR fulfills the following requirements:

- [x] The commit message follows our guidelines: https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#commit
- [x] Tests for the changes have been added (for bug fixes / features)
- [x] Docs have been added / updated (for bug fixes / features)


## PR Type
What kind of change does this PR introduce?

<!-- Please check the one that applies to this PR using "x". -->

- [ ] Bugfix
- [ ] Feature
- [ ] Code style update (formatting, local variables)
- [ ] Refactoring (no functional changes, no api changes)
- [ ] Build related changes
- [ ] CI related changes
- [x] Documentation content changes
- [ ] angular.io application / infrastructure changes
- [ ] Other... Please describe:


## What is the current behavior?
<!-- Please describe the current behavior that you are modifying, or link to a relevant issue. -->
The [schematics for libraries guide](https://angular.io/guide/schematics-for-libraries) uses the `cp` command to copy schematics into the library's output directory (in the `package.json` file). The `cp` command is not a valid command in Windows cmd.exe and will throw an error it the scripts are executed.
Issue Number: 29952


## What is the new behavior?
Additional documentation explains that Windows users should use the `copy` command or look into a cross-platform solution such as [ncp](https://www.npmjs.com/package/ncp).

## Does this PR introduce a breaking change?

- [ ] Yes
- [x] No


<!-- If this PR contains a breaking change, please describe the impact and migration path for existing applications below. -->


## Other information
This fix is similar to the #30018 pull request, however it adds a reference to the Linux subsystem for Windows 10 (per recommendation by @Splaktar in #29952).
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "docs: add cross-platform support to the schematics for libraries guide" (#30966)

Issues.Title: build(bazel): update to nodejs rules 0.31.1 & bazel 0.26.1
Issues.Body:
Patch-only version of https://github.com/angular/angular/pull/30627

* entry_point attribute of nodejs_binary & rollup_bundle is now a label

* nodejs rules 0.30.1 has new feature to symlink node_modules with yarn_install and bazel 0.26.0 includes new managed_directories feature which enables this

* Symlinking of node_modules for yarn_install temporarily disabled (except for integration/bazel) until the fix for https://github.com/bazelbuild/bazel/issues/8487 makes it into a future bazel release. This is needed to work-around issue: yarn_install & npm_install with managed directories can't handle deleted or manually regenerated node_modules folder [https://github.com/bazelbuild/rules_nodejs/issues/802]. Underlying issue has been fixed in Bazel https://github.com/bazelbuild/bazel/issues/8487 but hasn't landed in a release yet
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "build(bazel): update to nodejs rules 0.31.1 & bazel 0.26.1" (#30965)

Issues.Title: fix(ivy): ngcc - prevent crash for packages without "main" property
Issues.Body:
When determining the module type of a bundle pointed to by the "main"
property, ngcc needs to read the bundle to figure out if it is CommonJS
or UMD format. However, when the "main" property does not exist ngcc
would crash while determining the path to the main bundle file.

This commit fixes the crash by checking if the "main" property is present
at all, before attempting to derive a full path to the bundle file.

Fixes #30916
Fixes FW-1369
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "fix(ivy): ngcc - prevent crash for packages without "main" property" (#30950)

Issues.Title: Component Analysis API for `NgtscProgram`
Issues.Body:
# Component Analysis API for `NgtscProgram`

### Relevant Package
This feature request is for @angular/compiler-cli.

### Description
This issue proposes exposing a new API on `NgtscProgram` that produces semantic information about components discovered in the program for use by an Angular indexer.

[Design Document](https://hackmd.io/@X3ECPVy-RCuVfba-pnvIpw/BkDUxaW84/%2FwqhNytHfR--9h4OVdox87g?type=book) on Ivy Design Docs

### Describe the solution you'd like
An API on `NgtscProgram` that generates semantic information about components, using the Ivy compilation pipeline (specifically `IvyCompilation` and `DecoratorHandler`s). Generation of semantic information will be housed in a new package `ngtsc/indexer`. More details on the [design document](https://hackmd.io/@X3ECPVy-RCuVfba-pnvIpw/BkDUxaW84/%2FwqhNytHfR--9h4OVdox87g?type=book).

### Describe alternatives you've considered
- Previously, extraction of semantic information about components was done via reliance on internal compiler APIs and unwrapping of private fields, which is not maintainable.
- Another alternative is to expose fields on the Program and Compilation, but this is also undesirable as it eliminates opaqueness of the compiler.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Component Analysis API for `NgtscProgram`" (#30959)

Issues.Title: feat(ivy): introduce missing-injectable migration for google3
Issues.Body:
Introduces a new migration schematic for adding the `@Injectable()`
decorator to provider classes which are currently not migrated. Previously
in ViewEngine, classes which are declared as providers sometimes don't
require the `@Injectable()` decorator (e.g. https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-hpo7gw)

With Ivy, provider classes need to be explicitly decorated with the `@Injectable()`
decorator if they are declared as providers of a given module. This commit
introduces a migration schematic that adds the explicit decorator automatically
to places where the decorator is currently missing.

The migration logic is designed in a CLI devkit and TSlint agnostic way so that we
can eventually also enable this as a public CLI migration for `ng update`. This will
be handled as part of a follow-up to reiterate on console output etc.

Resolves FW-1371
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "feat(ivy): introduce missing-injectable migration for google3" (#30956)

Issues.Title: fix(ivy): ensure that changes to component resources trigger incremental builds
Issues.Body:
Optimisations to skip compiling source files that had not changed
did not account for there being only changes to a resource file,
such as a template or style file.

Now we track such dependencies and trigger a recompilation
if any of the previously tracked resources have changed.

Closes #30947
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(ivy): ensure that changes to component resources trigger incremental builds" (#30954)

# üöÄ Feature request


### Command (mark with an `x`)
<!-- Can you pin-point the command or commands that are relevant for this feature request? -->
<!-- ‚úçÔ∏èedit: -->
```
- [ ] new
- [ ] build
- [ ] serve
- [ ] test
- [ ] e2e
- [ ] generate
- [ ] add
- [x] update
- [ ] lint
- [ ] xi18n
- [ ] run
- [ ] config
- [ ] help
- [ ] version
- [ ] doc
```

### Description
<!-- ‚úçÔ∏è--> Considering there is a project with tsconfig.ts file somewhere deep in folder structure. Node_modules folder and package.json file lays in the root of an application. When running "ng update" command from the root of an application it will update package.json and throw an error saying "Could not find any tsconfig file. Cannot migrate DOCUMENT to new import source". Which is obvious, since there is no single tsconfig on the root, but multiple tcsonfig files across the application.

### Describe the solution you'd like
<!-- ‚úçÔ∏è--> It would be great if we could run migration tool specifying a path to tsconfig.ts file.

### Describe alternatives you've considered
<!-- ‚úçÔ∏è--> Updating all files manually is painful. The folder structure is designed this way for a reason and is unlikely to be changed.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "[ng update] Allow specifying path to tsconfig file" (#30952)

Issues.Title: docs: define type as any to the example decorator.
Issues.Body:
## Description:
`@ViewChild('sampleCanvas', {static: false}) sampleCanvas;` was throwing following error: 
```
Argument of type '{ static: boolean; }' is not assignable to parameter of type '{ read?: any; }'.
  Object literal may only specify known properties, and 'static' does not exist in type '{ read?: any; }'.
```
In order to fix the error, we have to define the type as `any`.

To expedite issue processing please search open and closed issues before submitting a new one.

# üöÄ feature request

### Relevant Package
<!-- Can you pin-point one or more @angular/* packages the are relevant for this feature request? -->
@angular-devkit/architect    0.13.7 (cli-only)
@angular-devkit/core         7.3.7 (cli-only)
@angular-devkit/schematics   7.3.7 (cli-only)
@schematics/angular          7.3.7 (cli-only)
@schematics/update           0.13.7 (cli-only)
rxjs                         6.4.0
 "ng-recaptcha": "^4.3.0"


### Description
I am trying to display google ``reCAPTCHA`` inside specifics components from my application. 

- For some reasons, I must encapsulate some components from my application. To do that I am using ``ViewEncapsulation.ShadowDom``. 

- From the ``app.module.ts`` I have installed ``RecaptchaModule``, a [package ](https://www.npmjs.com/package/ng-recaptcha) that handles reCAPTCHA. 

My issue is about the ``reCAPTCHA`` <=> ``ViewEncapsulation.ShadowDom``. 

From what I can tell, the ``ViewEncapsulation.ShadowDom`` blocks the iframe reCAPTCHA from google to work as expected. 

If I remove the ``ViewEncapsulation.ShadowDom`` from my component everything works fine :-)
But if I add the ``ViewEncapsulation.ShadowDom`` and then run the application the console displays the following issue message: 
> recaptcha__en.js:527 Uncaught DOMException: Blocked a frame with origin "https://www.google.com" from accessing a cross-origin frame. 

Does the use  of ``ShadowDom``  means that we cannot use frames ? Is there another way to use frames ?

Issues.Title: docs(aio): Testing example app doesn't work since Angular 8
Issues.Body:
# üêû bug report
### Is this a regression?
Yes, it wasn't present in the latest 7 release (see below)

### Description
https://angular.io/guide/testing#support-more-macrotasks describes a way to support more macro tasks, the Canvas example is even used in the sample app that you can download at the top of that same page (source code: https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/master/aio/content/examples/testing/src/app/shared/canvas.component.spec.ts).

I noticed that the example app doesn't allow to run `ng test` (due to missing tsconfig file), so I was working on fixing that in order to send in PR to patch it. Once I managed to run `ng test` successfully (as in: the tests are extecuted), I noticed that 3 tests failed. I fixed 2 of them (we can discuss the reasons of their failure in the PR once it's up as I think it's unrelated to what I'll be describing here), but I can't seem to resolve the 3th test (which I will describe in the reproduction steps below). I noticed that the code to support the macro tasks isn't working properly anymore.

I'm not sure this is an issue with Angular or an issue with ZoneJS. Maybe it's not even an issue and we can fix this easily by updating the docs' tests. In that case I'll be happy to fix it as part of the PR I'm finishing.

As I noticed @JiaLiPassion created this test initially (https://github.com/angular/angular/pull/21669), and, if I remember correctly, also added this functionality into zonejs, I wanted to check if you might have any idea what has been changed in zonejs that would break this test?


## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction (issue in the docs)
- Open the Angular repo locally
- checkout master
- cd into aio and run `yarn build`
- cd into `aio/content/examples/testing` and run `yarn test`

3 tests should fail. You can ignore the `No test scheduler initialized` for now, I've managed to resolve this locally by patching the exampleZipper but this issue is only about the one that's failing with the following message:
```
chrome 74.0.3729 (Linux 0.0.0) CanvasComponent should be able to generate blob data from canvas FAILED
    Error: Expected undefined to be greater than 0.
        at <Jasmine>
        at UserContext.<anonymous> (src/app/shared/canvas.component.spec.ts:24:26)
        at UserContext.<anonymous> (home/frederik/Development/github/frederikprijck/angular/aio/tools/examples/shared/node_modules/zone.js/dist/zone-testing.js:1493:1)
        at ZoneDelegate.invoke (home/frederik/Development/github/frederikprijck/angular/aio/tools/examples/shared/node_modules/zone.js/dist/zone-evergreen.js:359:1)
```

## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction (underlying issue isolated from the docs)
As it was easier for me to swap dependency versions to find the issue, I isolated the issue in an empty cli project:
- Create a new @angular/cli 8 project
- Add this component https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/master/aio/content/examples/testing/src/app/shared/canvas.component.ts and this test https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/master/aio/content/examples/testing/src/app/shared/canvas.component.spec.ts to the project
- run `ng test`

The tests should fail with:
```
chrome 74.0.3729 (Linux 0.0.0) CanvasComponent should be able to generate blob data from canvas FAILED
    Error: Expected undefined to be greater than 0.
        at <Jasmine>
        at UserContext.<anonymous> (src/app/shared/canvas.component.spec.ts:24:26)
        at UserContext.<anonymous> (home/frederik/Development/github/frederikprijck/angular/aio/tools/examples/shared/node_modules/zone.js/dist/zone-testing.js:1493:1)
        at ZoneDelegate.invoke (home/frederik/Development/github/frederikprijck/angular/aio/tools/examples/shared/node_modules/zone.js/dist/zone-evergreen.js:359:1)
```
If we do the same, but for an @angular/cli 7 project, the test works fine.
Once we upgrade `zone` to `0.9.1` (which is the version used when using `@angular/cli` 8) in an Angular 7 project, the tests fail. 

It's also broken with zone.js `0.9.0` but works fine with `0.8.29`.

This might be a regression in zonejs, however I'm not that familiar with zonejs so I was hoping to hear @JiaLiPassion 's opinion on this.

## üî• Exception or Error
Test is not succeeding.

## üåç  Your Environment
I've tested this with Angular 7 and 8, on Linux (Elementary OS) and Windows 10.

Issues.Title: fix(ivy): handle empty bindings in template type checker
Issues.Body:
**refactor(compiler): tighten `AstVisitor` types**

Previously, an `EmptyExpr` node was not reported to `AstVisitor`,
which resulted in silently converting it into `undefined` during
AST transforms. This has led to various crashes in different areas
of the compiler, as the `undefined` value was typically not
accounted for.

This commit extends the `AstVisitor` to accept an `EmptyExpr` node
and introduces a generic type that the return value of each visit method
should satisfy.

---

**fix(ivy): handle empty bindings in template type checker**
When a template contains a binding without a value, the template parser
creates an `EmptyExpr` node. This would previously be translated into
an `undefined` value, which would cause a crash downstream as `undefined`
is not included in the allowed type, so it was not handled properly.

This commit prevents the crash by returning an actual expression for empty
bindings.

Fixes #30076, #30929
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(ivy): handle empty bindings in template type checker" (#30938)

Issues.Body:
# üêû Bug report ### Command ``` - [x] serve ``` ### Is this a regression? Yes? I didn't use AOT for dev mode serving previously because it wasn't as performant as it is now in Ivy. ### Description The [Ivy Guide](https://angular.io/guide/ivy) suggests enabling `"aot": true` for dev mode builds. What I‚Äôm finding during that experience is that while the rebuilds are super fast in Dev mode (`aot: true`), the Angular CLI often doesn‚Äôt pick up changes to SCSS and HTML. I need to constantly re-run `ng serve` over and over again to see my changes. It‚Äôs not the kind of DX that we‚Äôre looking for. Changing back to `aot: false` works around this issue. ## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction - https://github.com/angular-hispano/angular-hispano/tree/enableIvy - `npm start` - Make changes to files like the following and see that the build reports ```sh Date: 2019-06-09T02:07:26.153Z - Hash: fd4823b00365cd497714 - Time: 192ms 7 unchanged chunks ‚Ñπ ÔΩ¢wdmÔΩ£: Compiled successfully. ``` But the changes aren't reflected in the browser. Issues.Title: ng serve doesn't serve valid MIME types
Issues.Body:
# üêû Bug report ### Command (mark with an `x`) - [ ] new - [ ] build - [x] serve - [ ] test - [ ] e2e - [ ] generate - [ ] add - [ ] update - [ ] lint - [ ] xi18n - [ ] run - [ ] config - [ ] help - [ ] version - [ ] doc ### Is this a regression? I've not tried before v7. ### Description Local sites served by `ng serve` do not add the correct MIME types to the headers of files it serves, nor does it look like Content-Type is sent at all from dev-server. For my use, most commonly served images and webfonts are listed as `text/plain` in Chrome's dev tools Network tab instead of their correct types. Among other side effects is that when previewing the content in dev tools they're just shown as plain text gibberish of their actual binary contents. Interestingly enough, the resources seem to embed ok in the various pages of the site, e.g. images display as images and webfonts are used as webfonts instead of broken images or unloaded fonts. Don't know why the disparity between the two interfaces of the same browser. ## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction Create an Angular app, put an image that gets embedded and a webfont (woff or woff2 format should be fine here) to be used in an assets folder and reference them in a page or component. Then `ng serve` the app and view the results in the browser's dev tools. ## üåç Your Environment

    / \   _ __   __ _ _   _| | __ _ _ __     / ___| |   |_ _|
   / ‚ñ≥ \ | '_ \ / _` | | | | |/ _` | '__|   | |   | |    | |
  / ___ \| | | | (_| | |_| | | (_| | |      | |___| |___ | |
 /_/   \_\_| |_|\__, |\__,_|_|\__,_|_|       \____|_____|___|
                |___/

Node: 8.11.2
OS: win32 x64
Angular:
...

------------------------------------------------------

@angular-devkit/schematics   7.3.8
@schematics/angular          7.3.8
@schematics/update           0.13.8
rxjs                         6.3.3
typescript                   3.2.4
**Anything else relevant?** Currently using Chrome 73, but almost certainly in other browsers. Windows 7, currently using VSCode 1.34 for development and calling package.json commands I looked a little bit into what config `ng serve` passes to webpack and noticed nothing related to proper MIME types. My suggestion is ultimately we should be allowed to add a valid config or path to valid config for MIME types in angular.json that gets passed to webpack to use, or maybe even a webpack.config.js in project root that supplements and/or overrides angular.json's webpack config.

Issues.Title: 'ng test' fails when test assigns props to 'this'
Issues.Body:
# üêû Bug report ### Command (mark with an `x`) ``` - [ ] new - [ ] build - [ ] serve - [x] test - [ ] e2e - [ ] generate - [ ] add - [ ] update - [ ] lint - [ ] xi18n - [ ] run - [ ] config - [ ] help - [ ] version - [ ] doc ``` ### Is this a regression? Yes, the previous version in which this bug was not present was: 7.2.15 ### Description Tests fail to complete when assigning properties to `this`. The Jasmine documentation under https://jasmine.github.io/tutorials/your_first_suite explains the usage of `this` as follows: ``` The this keyword Another way to share variables between a beforeEach, it, and afterEach is through the this keyword. Each spec's beforeEach/it/afterEach has the this as the same empty object that is set back to empty for the next spec's beforeEach/it/afterEach. ``` ```typescript describe("A spec", function() { beforeEach(function() { this.foo = 0; }); it("can use the `this` to share state", function() { expect(this.foo).toEqual(0); this.bar = "test pollution?"; }); it("prevents test pollution by having an empty `this` created for the next spec", function() { expect(this.foo).toEqual(0); expect(this.bar).toBe(undefined); }); }); ``` When I include `this` references in my test suite the tests fail with ``` Failed: Cannot set property 'foo' of undefined ``` ## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction - Assign something to `this` in any test - Run `ng test` Should be fairly simple to reproduce, but in case example is necessary a reproduction of the issue is hosted at https://github.com/jakkn/angular8-cli-ng-test-this-bug-repro ## üî• Exception or Error

Issues.Title: DL fixes for safari and false negatives for ES6 module support
Issues.Body:
**fix(@angular-devkit/build-angular): nomodule polyfill for Safari 10.1 and iOS Safari 10.3**

The nomodule polyfill needs to be inject prior to any script and be
outside of webpack compilation because otherwise webpack will cause the
script to be wrapped in `window["webpackJsonp"]` which causes this to
fail.

Also, this ensures that it's loaded and executed prior to any other
nomodule script.

This polyfill will only be injected when the either Safari 10.1 or iOS
Safari 10.3 support is required, which is based on the browsers  defined in browserslist file.

Fixes #14680

**fix(@angular-devkit/build-angular): browsers that partially support es6 modules are being marked as not supported**

`caniuse-api`  only returns `true` for a feature when it's fully supported. This might causes redundant ES5 builds if users opt to support only browsers which do support ES6 modules but either require polyfills such as Safari 10.1 or when both bundles will be downloaded such as `Edge 18`

See: https://github.com/Nyalab/caniuse-api/blob/1b74c10257e36877709da4f6630513db10203a78/src/index.js#L49 and Nyalab/caniuse-api#82

Fixes #14580
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "DL fixes for safari and false negatives for ES6 module support" (#14716)

Issues.Title: Whitespaces on HTML
Issues.Body: # üöÄ Feature request ### Command (mark with an `x`) ``` - [x] build - [x] serve ``` ### Description Hello, we're experiencing issues when webpack compiles our application because angular does not allow us to modify whitespace settings. Currently the whitespace settings are not available via the cli config, which causes that each and every single line of HTML code to have a whitespace in between when minified. This settings eventually leads to have HTML code resulting as this: ``` My link .``` And therefore to have a sentence with spaces around clickable. The responsible for the HTML and I have tried to find a way to proceed but we haven't found a consistent solution that solves 100% of the issues, so my question is: Is there any particular reason angular is preventing us to change this setting? ### Describe the solution you'd like Configurable angular-cli or webpack configuration. ### Describe alternatives you've considered Talking with my team we was considering to expand webpack configuration with ngx-build-plus but we think is a problem to be solved on official cli.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Whitespaces on HTML" (#14715)

Issues.Title: Unexpected behaviour for "ng build --aot"
Issues.Body:
# üêû Bug report ### Command (mark with an `x`) ``` - [ ] new - [x] build - [ ] serve - [ ] test - [ ] e2e - [ ] generate - [ ] add - [ ] update - [ ] lint - [ ] xi18n - [ ] run - [ ] config - [ ] help - [ ] version - [ ] doc ``` ### Is this a regression? Can't say for sure ### Description ``` User Type {{role}} ``` The above code is present in a template for a component inside a lazy loaded module put behind canLoad and canActivate guards The app is designed to not to fetch any lazy-loaded modules except the login module, which sets up the current user from a jwt, etc etc, and only after that the canLoad guards will allow other modules to be fetched. Everything works fine if I use **ng build --watch** However, if I use **ng build --watch --aot**, then for some reason the server (IIS) returns a 404 for the chunk 'default~.......-~(somenumber).js', even though the file is already present in the file system folder. The CLI generates no errors, either. Obviously, this renders my entire app useless, because unless I log in, I can't do anything at all. There are no problems if I use **ng build --prod** I can't even diagnose where the error is happening exactly, as the modules are not even loading The only difference between this and other similar implementations of mat-select in my app is that the mat-options in this case are made from an array of string enumerations (typeOptions). ## üî• Exception or Error ## üåç Your Environment

No ### Description A clear and concise description of the problem... I have an angular 5 application, which I am able to localize using the angular documentation. But I have few strings that are added in the ts file i.e adding months,days, year to the age after computing the age. I am not finding a way to localize it. Also I get some data from a local json file with id and name property. I need to localize the value in the name property. ## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction By running i18n strings in ts file and json file can't be reproduced. There is no way to specify them to localize. ## üî• Exception or Error
## üåç Your Environment 

 Angular cli - 1.6.3
**Anything else relevant?**

Issues.Title: `ng serve` does not respect `deleteOutputPath` option in build target
Issues.Body:
# üêû Bug report ### Command (mark with an `x`) ``` - [ ] new - [ ] build - [x] serve - [ ] test - [ ] e2e - [ ] generate - [ ] add - [ ] update - [ ] lint - [ ] xi18n - [ ] run - [ ] config - [ ] help - [ ] version - [ ] doc ``` ### Is this a regression? Yes, the previous version in which this bug was not present was: 7 ### Description `ng serve` will not respect the `deleteOutputPath` option in its `browserTarget`. Issues.Title: Keeping version numbers in sync in angular library project package.json files
Issues.Body:
When building an Angular Library application, is there an automated way to keep the root level package.json and the library application's package.json (e.g. under `projects/my-library`) file versions in sync when using `npm version` commands?

When I use the command, its only incrementing the root level package.json, is there a special command, or any other way to propagate the version number down to the library package.json file?

I have seen some solutions such as running a script after `ng build` to read the root level package.json version number and write that into the library one. Is this a good approach or are there better ways supported with the cli?

Thanks
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Keeping version numbers in sync in angular library project package.json files" (#14699)

Issues.Title: fix(@angular-devkit/build-angular): re-order ES5 polyfills in karma H‚Ä¶
Issues.Body:
‚Ä¶TMLs

Similar to the index HTML page (https://github.com/angular/angular-cli/blob/6ec09919b5c2695dee784ce0c3accee7f9754bb0/tests/legacy-cli/e2e/tests/misc/support-ie.ts#L30-L37) ES5 polyfills should be loaded prior to the other polyfills. This is because other polyfills such as `zone.js` require these for example `Symbol` and `Object.isFrozen`

Fixes #14618
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "fix(@angular-devkit/build-angular): re-order ES5 polyfills in karma H‚Ä¶" (#14693)

Issues.Title: fix(overlay): incorrectly calculating position when page is scrolled horizontally and overlay is anchored to the right
Issues.Body:
Fixes the flexible connected position strategy calculating where to position the panel incorrectly if it's anchored so that its content flows to the left and the page is scrolled horizontally. Furthermore, the calculations for the bounding box width weren't correct for this case either.

Fixes #16009.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "fix(overlay): incorrectly calculating position when page is scrolled horizontally and overlay is anchored to the right" (#16235)

Issues.Title: Drag/drop placeholder doesn't work if placeholder is smaller than draggable list elements
Issues.Body:
#### Bug, feature request, or proposal:
Bug

#### What is the expected behavior?
The placeholder should be placed correctly, regardless of if the placeholder is the same size as the list elements or a different size.

#### What is the current behavior?
The placeholder is in the wrong spot in the list while dragging an element, but only if the placeholder is smaller (less height for a vertical list, or less width for a horizontal list).


#### What are the steps to reproduce?
Stackblitz: https://angular-ztyby3.stackblitz.io
Drag the top element down. Observe that the placeholder moves to the top. Then, move it back upwards, and observe that the placeholder moves to the bottom. This is the opposite of how the placeholder should work.

#### What is the use-case or motivation for changing an existing behavior?
It does not work as expected.

#### Which versions of Angular, Material, OS, TypeScript, browsers are affected?
@angular/*: 8.0.0
OS: Win10
TS: 3.4.5

#### Is there anything else we should know?
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Drag/drop placeholder doesn't work if placeholder is smaller than draggable list elements" (#16259)

Fixes #16243.

Issues.Title: Add hideRequiredMarker to MatFormFieldDefaultOptions
Issues.Body:
#### Feature Description

Please add an option to MatFormFieldDefaultOptions to hide the required marker on the field.
This will allow us to default all form fields to hide the required marker instead of specifying the hideRequiredMarker input on each one. Add the field to MatFormFieldDefaultOptions and default the value of the hideRequiredMarker input of MatFormField this this value (I think this is trivial)

#### Use Case

In our app our UX team wants all fields required by default, so the required marker is overkill. We have to specify hideRequiredMarker on every single usage of MatFormField which is tedious and becomes error prone. Add this feature would eliminate this issue for us.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Add hideRequiredMarker to MatFormFieldDefaultOptions" (#16243)

Issues.Title: Cannot use *ngIf on Datepicker. <mat-datepicker *ngIf="true"> does not open.
Issues.Body:
#### Reproduction

https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-drdwxq-th8kkk

Steps to reproduce:

1. Add `*ngIf` to datepicker: `<mat-datepicker *ngIf="true" #picker>`
 
#### Expected Behavior

If the condition is true, the datepicker should open like normal

#### Actual Behavior

The datepicker stops working and cannot be opened

#### Environment

- Angular:
- CDK/Material:
- Browser(s): Chrome
- Operating System: Windows

#### Reason

- I need to create a generalized input component that can be used to render all possible inputs like this:
```html
<app-input type="datepicker">
<app-input type="creditCard">
<app-input type="lotsOfOtherCustomTypes">
```

- I want to hide `<mat-datepicker #picker>` for all other inputs like my custom creditCard input conditionally.
- *ngIf works on `<mat-datepicker-toggle>` like it should
- This is how I would like to use it:
```html
<input
    matInput
    [formControl]="formControl"
    [errorStateMatcher]="matcher"
    [matDatepicker]="type === 'datepicker' ? myDatepicker : null"
  />
<mat-datepicker-toggle
    *ngIf="type === 'datepicker'"
    [for]="myDatepicker"
    matSuffix
></mat-datepicker-toggle>
<mat-datepicker
    *ngIf="type === 'datepicker'"
    #myDatepicker
></mat-datepicker>
```
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Cannot use *ngIf on Datepicker. <mat-datepicker *ngIf="true"> does not open." (#16239)

Issues.Title: Sidenav startup animation when using two sidenavs and router
Issues.Body:
#### Reproduction

this is the stackblitz - https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-material-sidenav-issue

In order to see the working as expected example jump between about and home - the sidenav is opened with no animation to the sidenav and no animation to the content.

Steps to reproduce the problem:
1. click toggle sidenav - the main sidenav will open with animation
2. go to about - the inner sidenav will appear without animation to the sidenav itself but the content will animate (you can see it through the scroll bar).
 
#### Expected Behavior

The same as the working example - even when the main sidenav is opened the inner sidenav should render opened with no animation for the content.

#### Actual Behavior

The sidenav content didn't animate as expected - it animated although it shouldn't have.

#### Environment

- Angular: 8
- CDK/Material: 8
- Browser(s): Chrome 74
- Operating System (e.g. Windows, macOS, Ubuntu): Windows
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Sidenav startup animation when using two sidenavs and router" (#16236)

Issues.Title: v7 mat-form-field docs link to non versioned custom control guide (v8)
Issues.Body:
#### Documentation Feedback

If you switch to the v7 documentation and go to the form field component page, the link to the "Creating Custom mat-form-field Controls" guide takes you to the current page instead of to the v7 page.

We noticed this when trying to find a working stackblitz version of the example (since the current one is broken), but it looks like there is already an issue open (#13195) for that part of the problem.

**Affected documentation page:** 
https://v7.material.angular.io/components/form-field/overview#custom-form-field-controls

https://material.angular.io/guide/creating-a-custom-form-field-control
should be:
https://v7.material.angular.io/guide/creating-a-custom-form-field-control
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "v7 mat-form-field docs link to non versioned custom control guide (v8)" (#16232)

Issues.Title: Changing tabs while parent div is animating into the page causes the content to disappear.
Issues.Body:
#### Reproduction

Here is a StackBlitz to reproduce the issue: https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-yqxzaq

Steps to reproduce:
1. Animate a div into the page that contains material tab component.
2. Change tabs as this parent div is animating into the page.
3. Wait for the last div to finish animating into the page.
4. The tab you switched now has no content.
 
 
#### Expected Behavior

If you change tabs while the parent div is animating into the page then the content should not disappear.


#### Actual Behavior

If you change tabs while the tabs are animating into the page then the content does disappear and is gone until you refresh the page.


#### Environment

- Angular: 8.0.0
- CDK/Material: 8.0.0
- Browser(s): Firefox developer edition 68.0b7 (64-bit), Chrome 75.0.3770.80
- Operating System: Windows
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Changing tabs while parent div is animating into the page causes the content to disappear." (#16230)
